cyclone.name: MINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi WSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast across the eastern Florida Panhandle tonight, then forecast to track offshore the Southeast U.S. coast into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle between Mexico Beach and Steinhatchee River (near Apalachicola)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch/Warning posted from Mexico Beach to Steinhatchee River, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Mexico Beach to Steinhatchee River, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Florida Panhandle tonight, then portions of coastal Georgia and South Carolina Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; tropical-storm-force winds not expected at the Port of South Louisiana.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the Port of South Louisiana due to track well east of the Mississippi Delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only light to moderate outer-band showers possible; heavy rainfall unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minimal. Primary operational impact will be potential disruptions to shipping lanes east of the Mississippi Delta rather than at the port itself.
